title: Iris and Apollo
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Claude Gillot [1673-1722]. Émile Louis Dominique Calando [1840-1898], Paris, France (Lugt 837) [1]; probably his sale, December 11-12, 1899, Hotel des Commissaires-Priseurs, Rue Druot, No. 9, Paris, France [2]; acquired by his son Émile Pierre Victor Calando [1872-1953], Paris and Grasse, France (Lugt 426b) [3]. Helene C. Seiferheld Gallry, Inc., New York, NY [4]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 [5]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. His collector's mark is stamped on the drawing (recto lower left.)
[2]. The sale, entitled "Dessins Anciens," included several Gillot drawings of mythological subjects of the size of the present drawing, which were not specifically identified.
[3]. His collector's mark is stamped on the drawing (verso bottom.) His sale at Hotel Drouot, Paris, on March 17-18, 1927 apparently did not include this drawing.
[4]. Inscription in pencil "1997 Seiferheld" (verso.) Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through the Seiferheld gallery in NYC, which was active throughout the 1960s under various names.
[5]. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, on June 12, 1974; see curatorial file for loan form and list of works.

creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
